concise_definition: v. 喷洒, 喷射; n. 喷雾, 喷射物

definitions.explanation_en: To discharge a liquid or fine particles in a stream of droplets or a fine mist, typically using pressure or a specialized device.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过压力或专用设备将液体或微小颗粒以雾状或细滴形式喷射出来。
definitions.example_en: She sprayed perfume lightly over her dress before the party.
definitions.example_cn: 她在参加派对前，轻轻在裙子上喷了些香水。

definitions.explanation_en: To cover or coat a surface by spraying liquid or particles onto it.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过喷洒液体或颗粒物来覆盖或涂覆某表面。
definitions.example_en: Farmers spray pesticides on crops to protect them from insects.
definitions.example_cn: 农民在作物上喷洒杀虫剂以防止虫害。

definitions.explanation_en: A stream or burst of liquid or particles ejected in a fine mist or droplets.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以雾状或细滴形式喷射出的液体或颗粒物的喷射流。
definitions.example_en: The ocean waves sent a spray of saltwater into the air.
definitions.example_cn: 海浪将一缕咸水喷雾溅入空中。

definitions.explanation_en: A type of aerosol product, such as hair spray or paint spray, designed to be dispensed in a fine mist.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指设计用于以细雾形式释放的气溶胶产品，如发胶或喷漆。
definitions.example_en: He used a hair spray to keep his hairstyle in place all day.
definitions.example_cn: 他用了发胶让发型一整天都保持原状。

comparison.analysis: “Sprinkle” (撒, 洒) 指少量、分散地洒落液体或颗粒，通常动作轻柔、范围小，如撒糖、撒盐。而 “spray” 强调以压力喷出连续的雾状物，覆盖范围更广、力度更强，常用于专业或工业场景。
“Spatter” (溅洒) 指液体因撞击或飞溅而形成不规则、零散的斑点或污迹，常带有意外或混乱的意味，如油漆溅到墙上。而 “spray” 是有控制的、均匀的雾状喷射，目的性更强。
“Mist” (薄雾) 作为名词时指自然形成的细小水滴悬浮在空气中，如晨雾；作为动词时极少使用。而 “spray” 是人为制造的喷雾，强调动作或产品，如喷雾瓶、喷雾剂。两者在形态上相似，但 “spray” 更具人为干预和功能性。
